contents.item: Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results.

You are good. But it is not enough just to be good. You must be good for something. You must contribute good to the world. The world must be a better place for your presence. And the good that is in you must be spread to others....

A man can only lead when others accept him as their leader, and he has only as much authority as his subjects give to him. All of the brilliant ideas in the world cannot save your kingdom if no one will listen to them.
contents.owner: Brandon Sanderson, The Well of Ascension

contents.item: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each
...A man can only stumble for so long before he either falls or stands up straight.
contents.owner: Brandon Sanderson, The Well of Ascension

contents.item: Lead me, follow me, or get the hell out of my way.
contents.owner: George S. Patton Jr., Patton Principles

contents.item: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.
A bit of adviceGiven to a young Native AmericanAt the time of his initiation:As you go the way of life,You will see a great chasm. Jump.It is not as wide as you think.

The day the soldiers stop bringing you their problems is the day you stopped leading them. They have either lost confidence that you can help them or concluded that you do not care. Either case is a failure of leadership.
You do not lead by hitting people over the head -- that's assault, not leadership.
Efficiency is doing the thing right. Effectiveness is doing the right thing.
A leader. . .is like a shepherd. He stays behind the flock, letting the most nimble go out ahead, whereupon the others follow, not realizing that all along they are being directed from behind.
contents.owner: Nelson Mandela, Long Walk to Freedom

contents.item: Not all readers are leaders, but all leaders are readers.
Being responsible sometimes means pissing people off.
A leader is a dealer in hope.
The best executive is the one who has sense enough to pick good men to do what he wants done, and self-restraint to keep from meddling with them while they do it.

Some are young people who don't know who they are, what they can be or even want to be. They are afraid, but they don't know of what. They are angry, but they don't know at whom. They are rejected and they don't know why. All they want is to be somebody.
contents.owner: Thomas S. Monson, Pathways To Perfection: Discourses Of Thomas S. Monson

contents.item: A leader takes people where they want to go. A great leader takes people where they don't necessarily want to go, but ought to be.
I would like to be known as a person who is concerned about freedom and equality and justice and prosperity for all people.
The secret of leadership is simple: Do what you believe in. Paint a picture of the future. Go there.People will follow.
contents.owner: Seth Godin, Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us
